children.subject: I meant what's your gut feeling on what to do
Not idea... that's why I'm asking for advice.
Okay I won't continue asking then. The idea was to ask follow up questions based on your answer to help you make a decision.

I go to lecture every single day. I have missed one one in the whole semester. I have to admit I am taking 3 technical classes and one non technical. I have have while on midterm 1 I got a grade barely with the lowest std dev, midterm 2 went bad. Like literally 20%. I do the hws but always get around 60%. I'm doing well in the other 3 classes though. That's why Idk what is going on.

You should email your professor, set up a 1 on 1, and show them your grades and tell them in detail how you've been preparing, and maybe they can help. Maybe they'll tell you what they expect your grade to be as of now.

I remember getting basically 100% on every hw, but when I first started, I had no idea how to do most of them. It took time, but I spent many hours in OH, studied with tons of friends, and asked a lot of questions on piazza. I read every notes, and didn't attend a single lecture.

I just had to spend a lot of time understanding the notes and doing practice problems to get the material. You're probably just too busy this semester.

Are you re-reading notes to consolidate your understanding? Regardless, looks like you're doing well enough to not take stat 134. If you end up failing, just retake 70.
I actually did both things and the professor told me something that I don't want to discuss here.

Still, I really appreciate your advice. I won't give up just yet although I know that chances to pass are low. I am taking  notes from the notes and spend quite a lot reviewing for midterm. Yes I have fallen behind these couple of weeks but is because I don't want to risk the other classes too.

You could also late drop the course, deadline is next week though. May 3rd I think, possibly earlier.

Regardless, hope it works out. Just take it this summer. I took it during the summer and it was a great experience and chill.

Thank you. Yeah I was thinking in the green petition but I guess I will have to think about it. I did talk with my ESS advisor but there wasn't much I could do other than use it now or risk to have a glow low low grade in my transcript.

Why do you think you'll get an F? I don't think it's just because you haven't seen the material before. Have you been taking too many units? Spending too much time recruiting? Are you just not watching lecture and/or reading notes? Are you doing the hw?

Just curious why you think you're failing, and I think the honest audit can help you make the decision. You still have 2.5 weeks to prep for the final, and the curve is generous.

I recommend summer. You've already seen the material. You can focus on 70 those 8 weeks, and there's less hws. You can simply get it out of the way.

The digestion processes is the problem for this kind of material. I mean I aced all other math classes including linear algebra and multivariable calculus but distributions and random variables just don't click in my head.
Once I went for help and the TA looked seemingly desperate since I didn't get the concept and I felt ashamed. I just said thanks and never went back. That's probably one mistake I did.
What's an example of a problem that you didn't understand?

I've had TA's like that OP. It sucks. They just kinda look at you with annoyance. Those are the classes I would have struggled in if that was the only TA that could help.

For future courses, if you run into a TA like that, just don't go back to them. Feel free to complain, but more importantly, go to another TA. If you have a question, don't leave the TA until you understand. Take charge of your education.

Just because a TA was hired, doesn't mean they're good at their job. Always use your resources like piazza and OH.
"Take charge of your education." Also if it's allowed, always browse discussions the first couple of weeks to find the TA you like the most.
I really appreciate the support and advice of you all. It means a lot.

Two things

1) I’m not sure taking stat 134 would help with 70. Even though 134 goes through the concepts more slowly, neither the lectures nor the textbook are particularly good at explaining the material. 70 goes faster but a lot of the explanations in this class are more intuitive, and the quality of homeworks are a lot better imo. 

2) I’ve found that the key skill for 70 is the ability to digest a new math concept reasonably quickly; I’m guessing this is what people mean by “mathematical maturity.” Now that you already have one pass through the material, I think you’ll surprise yourself with how much easier a second pass will feel, even if you’ve felt lost in your first pass. So I’d recommend taking it in the summer.

history.content: I am struggling a lot in the second module of CS70 this semester (since I have never taken on seen probability and statistics before, not even in high school) It is very likely that I will fail the class this semester (unless I "ace" the final, which is not going to happen). In the 'F' event, I was planing to take a low-paced stats class such as Stat 134 next Fall and then retry CS70 the following Spring. People have told me I should retake CS70 ASAP (like this summer) but I have the feeling I would fail it again. What would  be the best thing to do next?
history.subject: Failing CS70, Seeking Advice.
